params.keyManager: Address to grant key management permissions

params.proofTypes: Array of proof types corresponding to each proof

params.proofType: The type of proof to query

params._keyManagers: Initial key managers who can update verification keys

returns.isManager: True if address is a key manager

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.keyManager: Address to revoke key management permissions

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.maxBatchSize: Maximum number of proofs in a batch

params.circuitHash: Hash of the circuit for integrity verification
params.constraintCount: Number of constraints in the circuit

updateVerificationKey(uint256,bytes32).details: Only callable by authorized key manager

params.vkHash: Hash of the new verification key

params.operationHash: Hash of the operation to be executed

params.publicInputHash: Hash of public inputs (guardian commitment, challenge)

getCircuitParams(uint256).notice: Gets circuit parameters for a proof type

getVerificationKey(uint256).notice: Gets the current verification key for a proof type

getVerificationStats(uint256).notice: Gets verification statistics for a proof type

initialize(address,address[]).notice: Initializes the ZK Proof Verifier contract

isKeyManager(address).notice: Checks if an address is a key manager

pauseAllVerifications().notice: Emergency function to pause all verifications

updateCircuitParams(uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Updates circuit parameters for a proof type

updateVerificationKey(uint256,bytes32).notice: Updates verification key for a specific proof type
